title: Earth Love Fest Block Party and After Party
description: A block party and after party at House of Yes in Bushwick. Free admission.

title: Open Streets: Car-Free Earth Day
description: An event closing 54 locations across the city to vehicular traffic with activities, performances, and programming.

title: Broadway Celebrates Earth Day Concert
description: A concert in Times Square’s pedestrian plaza with free admission.

title: Loisaida United Neighborhood Gardens (LUNGS) Spring Awakening Celebration
description: A celebration at Avenue B between 7th and 9th Streets. Free admission.

title: Contemporary Jazz Masterpieces
description: A concert featuring the Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra with Wynton Marsalis. Tickets start at $33 with promo code SKINT30.
address: Jazz at Lincoln Center, 60th Street and Broadway

title: Earth Love Eco Bazaar at Grand Bazaar NYC
description: An eco bazaar taking place indoors and outdoors at 100 W 77th St at Columbus Ave. Free admission.

title: Dragon Fest Chinese Food + Culture Street Fair
description: A street fair taking place on Sixth Ave between 30th and 31st Streets. Free admission (pay-as-you-go).

title: Snack Attack Takedown Food Competition
description: A food competition at Royal Palms Shuffleboard in Gowanus. Admission is $30.

title: Buffalo Exchange’s Annual $1 Earth Day Sale
description: An annual sale at various locations in the East Village, NoHo, Chelsea, Boerum Hill, and Williamsburg. Cash only.
address: Various locations in East Village, NoHo, Chelsea, Boerum Hill, and Williamsburg

title: Governors Island Earth Day Celebration
description: A celebration on Governors Island with free admission.

title: Root in Peace: A Community Funeral for Our Dead Plants
description: A community event at Chinatown Soup in the Lower East Side. Free admission.

title: Earth Day Bike Repair Class
description: A bike repair class at La Plaza Community Garden in Alphabet City. Free admission.

title: Earth Day Community Garden Tour Bike Ride
description: A bike ride tour at La Plaza Community Garden in Alphabet City. Free admission.

title: Juilliard’s Annual Earth Month Celebration
description: An annual celebration at Juilliard with free admission.

title: Earth Day + Arbor Day Events in Parks and Community Gardens Across NYC
description: Various events in parks and community gardens across NYC with free admission.

title: Doom + Bloom: Brooklyn Horror Society Spring Market
description: A spring market hosted by the Brooklyn Horror Society at Wild East Brewing in Gowanus. Free admission.

title: Queens Night Market Season Opener
description: The season opener of the Queens Night Market at the New York Hall of Science in Flushing Meadows Corona Park. Admission is $5-8 for sneak preview days on 4/19 and 4/26, free admission starting 5/3.
address: New York Hall of Science at Flushing Meadows Corona Park

title: Japan Fes Japanese Food Festival
description: A food festival taking place at Broadway between 114th and 116th Streets on Saturday and Sixth Ave between 24th and 26th Streets on Sunday. Free admission (pay-as-you-go).
address: Broadway between 114th and 116th Streets (Saturday); Sixth Ave between 24th and 26th Streets (Sunday)

title: Brooklyn Bookstore Crawl
description: A crawl featuring 26 bookstores throughout Brooklyn. Running through April 26.

title: Rent the Runway Sample Sale
description: A sample sale featuring Rent the Runway at 260 Fifth Ave (between 28th and 29th Streets). Free admission.

title: Urbanspace’s Spring Makers Market
description: A market featuring various vendors at Bryant Park (Midtown). Open Fridays through Sundays from 11am to 7pm until June 1. Free admission.

title: Picasso: Tête-à-Tête
description: An exhibition at Gagosian Gallery featuring works by Picasso. Free admission.

title: Beyond Interface + Prompt: Exploring the Language of Technology in Contemporary Art
description: A multimedia exhibition at Williamsburg Art + Historical Center. Free admission (donations welcome). Opening reception on 4/18 from 6-8pm.

title: New York International Auto Show: 125th Anniversary
description: An auto show at the Jacob K. Javits Center featuring new, concept, and vintage vehicles. Admission is $22 (save $2 with promo code 'ride').

title: Killer of Sheep with Charles Burnett
description: A film screening at Film Forum with a Q&A session. Admission is $17.

title: Kingsland Wildflowers Green Roof Friday Evening Open Hours
description: An open hours event at Kingsland Wildflowers in Greenpoint. Free admission (RSVP required).

title: Kweendom
description: An LGBTQ+ comedy and storytelling show at Pete’s Candy Store in Williamsburg. Free admission (donations welcome).

title: Breakdancers vs Comedians
description: A competition at Eris Mainstage in Williamsburg. Admission is $12 in advance, $17 on the day of the event.

title: Best Night Ever Comedy Show
description: A stand-up comedy show at El Santo Taqueria in East Williamsburg/Bushwick. Admission is $12.51 in advance, $16+ on the day of the event.

title: Laugh It Off
description: A comedy show at Boyb. Melrose Podcasts in the East Village. Admission is $16.

title: Bitches Brew Comedy Show
description: A women-produced and hosted comedy show at Halyards in Gowanus. Free admission (tips appreciated).
